tool_description: Extracts and analyzes causal chains from incident narratives to identify root causes and contributing factors using natural language processing.

dataset_id.description: Identifier for the classified incident dataset

narrative_field.description: Name of the field containing incident narratives or descriptions

extraction_depth.description: Maximum depth of causal chain extraction (1-5 levels)

confidence_threshold.description: Minimum confidence for causal relationship extraction (0.0-1.0)

include_human_factors.description: Whether to specifically identify human factor contributions

causal_framework.description: Analysis framework: fishbone, five-whys, or bow-tie

language_model.description: NLP model for text analysis: standard, domain-specific, or advanced

error_messages: Dataset not found: Ensure dataset_id refers to a valid classified dataset.
Missing narrative field: The specified narrative_field does not exist in the dataset.
Invalid extraction depth: Value must be between 1 and 5.
Invalid confidence threshold: Value must be between 0.0 and 1.0.
Unsupported causal framework: Use fishbone, five-whys, or bow-tie.
Unsupported language model: Use standard, domain-specific, or advanced.
Insufficient text data: Narratives too short or incomplete for causal chain extraction.
usage: Provide dataset_id and narrative_field. Set extraction_depth for analysis complexity. Adjust confidence_threshold for precision. Choose appropriate causal_framework and language_model for your analysis needs.

root_causes.description: Identified root causes across all incidents

contributing_factors.description: Contributing factors that appear in causal chains

human_factor_frequency.description: Number of incidents with identified human factors

systemic_issues.description: Systematic organizational issues identified in causal chains

causal_chain_completeness.description: Average completeness score of extracted causal chains
